Citation

Source: inst/CITATION

Barber M, Walters M, Bump R (2005). “Short forms of two condition-specific quality-of-life questionnaires for women with pelvic floor disorders (PFDI-20 and PFIQ-7).” American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology, 193(1), 103-113. ISSN 0002-9378.

Yalcin I, Bump R (2003). “Validation of two global impression questionnaires for incontinence.” American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology, 189(1), 98-101. ISSN 0002-9378. 

@Article{,
  title = {Validation of two global impression questionnaires for incontinence},
  author = {Ilker Yalcin and Roger C. Bump},
  journal = {American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology},
  year = {2003},
  volume = {189},
  number = {1},
  pages = {98-101},
  issn = {0002-9378},
  publisher = {Elsevier},
  abstract = {The purpose of this study was to assess the construct validity of two global assessment questions, the Patient Global Impression of Severity and of Improvement, in female patients with stress urinary incontinence.},
}

Sandvik H, Seim A, Vanvik A, Hunskaar S (2000). “A severity index for epidemiological surveys of female urinary incontinence: Comparison with 48-hour pad-weighing tests.” Neurourology and Urodynamics, 19(2), 137-145. ISSN 1520-6777. 

@Article{,
  title = {A severity index for epidemiological surveys of female urinary incontinence: Comparison with 48-hour pad-weighing tests},
  author = {Hogne Sandvik and Anders Seim and Asbørn Vanvik and Steinar Hunskaar},
  journal = {Neurourology and Urodynamics},
  year = {2000},
  volume = {19},
  number = {2},
  pages = {137-145},
  issn = {1520-6777},
  publisher = {Wiley},
  address = {Bergen, Norway},
  abstract = {The severity index is based on information about frequency (four levels) and amount of leakage (two or three levels). By multiplication, an index value (1-8 or 1-12) is reached.},
}

Jelovsek J, Barber M (2006). “Patient-reported outcome measures in pelvic floor disorders.” American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology, 194(5), 1455-1461. ISSN 0002-9378.

ISSN 0002-9378.
